intro: Hylodesmum repandum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hylodesmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and are usually pink or red in color, adding ornamental value to the plant. Hylodesmum repandum prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical climates.
